H0.text: Movement of appendages requires the muscular, skeletal, and nervous systems to work together.

H1.text: Completion of blood circulation requires the muscular, skeletal, and nervous systems to work together.

H2.text: Absorption of nutrients requires the muscular, skeletal, and nervous systems to work together.

H3.text: Regulation of hormones is the function that requires the muscular, skeletal, and nervous systems to work together.

A4.text: Muscles are innervated by nerves, which conduct signals from the central nervous system to cause contraction.

A5.text: Skeletal muscles are attached to bones and arranged in opposing groups around joints.
